bibl.title: Samuel Gowen and Donald Webster v. JH McGraw. Order Granting Writ.
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.ab: Territory of Washington Third Judicial District SS.
In the District Court holding terms at Seattle in the County of King.
In the Matter of the Application of Samuel Gowen and Donald Webster for a Writ of Habeus Corpus.
div1.p: Upon reading and filing the petition and complaint of Samuel Gowan and Donald Webster, duly signed and verified by each of them severally, whereby it appears that they are illegally imprisioned and restrained of their liberty by JH McGraw, Sheriff of the said County of King at the County Jail in the said King County, Territory of Washington and stating wherein the said allegeditllegaity consists by ruigh it appeas to me that a Writ of Habeas Corpus ought to issue.

It is ordered that a Writ of Habeas Corpus issue out of and under the seal of the above named court, directed to the said J. H. McGraw, Sheriff as aforesaid, commanding him to have the bodies of the said Samuel Gowen and Donald Webster before me at my chambers in the city of Seattle, King County, Washington Territory, on the 26th day of Feburary, 1883, at ten o'clock in the forenoon of said dayto do and recieve what shall then and there be considered concerning the said applicants, Samuel Gowan and Donald Webster, together with the time and cause of their detention, and have then and ther the said writ.
div1.ab: No 3181 54th In Re Samuel Gowen and Donald Webster Habeas Corpus Order granting Writ Filed Feburary 24th 1883 James Seavey, Clerk. By James P. Ludlow Deputy Clerk. Hall + Wood for applicants.
